pros: It is a great place to work.
cons: I have no cons to share at this time.

pros: Students are great sometimes. Most want to work and learn.
cons: Administration is aggressively incompetent. They have no leadership skills and blame faculty for their own inability to make any substantial financial or cultural improvements.

pros: Students and some colleagues were wonderful
cons: Few people there can be trusted to do anything in anyone’s interests except their own.

job_title: IT Senior Director in Owensboro, KY
pros: Great colleagues. Staff committed to College's mission
cons: Disjointed executive leadership. Appeared to refuse to adjust financial practices. College is on probation with accreditor.

review_title: Low-value point institution with mostly dedicated faculty but woefully underfunded programs & antiquated facilities
pros: Mostly dedicated faculty and the college offers huge tuition discounts, particularly to athletes. Especially athletes.
cons: Leadership and stability are nearly absent.  Consider five presidents in less than ten years....current president is a lawyer.  Academic programs are without distinction.

job_title: Adjunct Assistant Professor in Owensboro, KY
pros: Warm, friendly environment, good availability with students and faculty.
cons: Very small. Not a lot of opportunity.
